FORM OF CONTRACT AGREEMENT

Articles of this Contract agreement made the {{dof.date_of_agreement}} between Sri. / Smt……………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………..……………………
………………………… (here enter name, designation and address of Contract agreement authority) acting for and on behalf of the Agency for Non-conventional Energy & Rural Technology (herein after called the “ANERT”) on one part and M/s {{doc.company}} Systems a Limited Liability Partnership Firm incorporated under the Limited Liability Partnership Act 2008 (LLP Act) and having its registered office at {% set company= frappe.get_doc("Company" ,doc.company)%} {% if company.address %} {% set add = frappe.get_doc("Address" , company.address) %} {% if(add.address_line1) %} {{add.address_line1}}{% endif %}{% if(add.address_line2) %},{{add.address_line2}}{% endif %} {% if(add.city) %},{{add.city}}{% endif %} {% if(add.pincode) %},-{{add.pincode}}{% endif %} (hereinafter called the Contractor) on the other part {% endif %}

WHEREAS the Agency for Non-conventional Energy & Rural Technology is taking up the construction of {{doc.panel_capacity}} KW On-Grid SPV Power Plant on behalf of the LSG/Institution.

AND WHEREAS the ANERT is desirous of starting the actual construction of the Rooftop Grid connected Solar Photovoltaic Power Plant at {% if(adds.address_line1) %} {{adds.address_line1}}{% endif %}{% if(adds.address_line2) %},{{adds.address_line2}}{% endif %} {% if(adds.city) %},{{adds.city}}{% endif %} {%if doc.corporation_or_municipality_or_panchayath %}{{doc.corporation_or_municipality_or_panchayath}} Panchayath {%endif%} hereinafter called the Beneficiary) at an early date for the benefit of the people.

AND WHEREAS the ANERT has invited tenders for the construction of Rooftop grid connected solar plant at {% if(adds.address_line1) %} {{adds.address_line1}}{% endif %}{% if(adds.address_line2) %},{{adds.address_line2}}{% endif %} {% if(adds.city) %},{{adds.city}}{% endif %} {%if doc.corporation_or_municipality_or_panchayath %}{{doc.corporation_or_municipality_or_panchayath}} Panchayath {%endif%} AND WHEREAS the Contractor has tendered for {{doc.panel_capacity}} KW On-Grid SPV Power Plant at {% if(adds.address_line1) %} {{adds.address_line1}}{% endif %}{% if(adds.address_line2) %},{{adds.address_line2}}{% endif %} {% if(adds.city) %},{{adds.city}}{% endif %} {%if doc.corporation_or_municipality_or_panchayath %}{{doc.corporation_or_municipality_or_panchayath}} Panchayath {%endif%}

AND WHEREAS the ANERT issued detailed work order No. {{dof.work_order_no}} dtd {{dof.date_of_execution}} for the execution of the work by the contractor.

AND WHEREAS the Contractor has furnished Performance Guarantee vid ………………………………… Dated {{dof.demand_draft_date}} of DEMAND DRAFT for sum of Rs {{dof.project_cost}}/- for the proper performance and the completion of the supply, installation, Testing and commissioning works of the SPV Power Plant in every aspect strictly as per work order no {{dof.work_order_no}} dated {{dof.issued_to_contractor_date}} issued to the contractor.

Now these presents witness and it is hereby mutually agreed as follows.

    In this agreement words and expressions shall have the same meaning as are respectively assigned to them in the conditions of contract herein after referred to.

1.SCOPE OF WORK

1.1 The purpose of this Agreement includes Design, Supply, Erection, Testing and Commissioning including Warranty, Operation &Maintenance for a period of 5 years of a {{doc.panel_capacity}} KWp roof-top Solar PV Power Plant (hereinafter referred to as the “Solar Power Plant”) for the Beneficiary,(hereinafter cumulatively referred to as the“Works”) , for which the Beneficiary has handed over the premises to the Contractor, along with required approvals from concerned authorities, and the Beneficiary’s entering into this Agreement is proof enough of its consent to start work thereon.
1.2 The Technical Specifications (hereinafter referred to as the “Technical Specifications”) that need to be adhered to by the Contractor in implementing the Solar PV Plant for the Beneficiary shall be in accordance with the ones issued by ANERT vide e-Tender No. {{dof.e_tender_no}} dtd {{dof.tender_dtd}}
1.3 All the pedestals meant for mounting the modules must be casted on the lintel by removing the tiles and other loose material in the area where the pedestals are to be casted. The surface of the lintel should be thoroughly cleaned and an adhesive should be applied on the lintel surface before casting the pedestals in order to have strong bonding with the lintel. After casting of the pedestals, the water proofing material should be applied surrounding the pedestals in order to avoid any water seepage during rainfall.
1.4 Contractor shall ensure that SPV modules, parts of MS structures, other hardware like nuts, bolts and grouting hardware etc., are not loosely scattered over the terrace of the building. These items must be securely stored in an enclosed room where they cannot be affected by winds or such loose materials must be tied properly. Further, Successful bidder shall ensure that rooftop Solar PV system should be designed and installed in such a way that its performance should not be affected due to the problem of water logging at site etc.
1.5 The Design, Engineering, Supply, Installation, Testing and Performance of the equipment shall be in accordance with latest appropriate IEC/Indian Standards as detailed in the Tender Document. Where appropriate Indian Standards and Codes are not available, other suitable standards and codes as approved by the MNRE/ANERT shall be used.
1.6 Any supplies which have not been specifically mentioned in this Contract but which are necessary for the Design, Engineering, Manufacture, Supply & Performance or completeness of the project shall be provided by the Bidder without any extra cost and within the time schedule for efficient and smooth operation and maintenance of the SPV plant

2.COMMENCEMENT AND COMPLETION

        The date of commencement of work under this contract shall be within 15days from the date of this Contract agreement and shall be diligently executed until it is complete in every respect. It shall be made ready for commissioning on or before 30 days.

3.PAYMENT TERMS

3.1 In consideration of the completion of Works, ANERT on behalf of the Beneficiary shall pay to CONTRACTOR from the amount deposited by the Beneficiary the Contract Price in Indian Rupee (INR). The “Price” shall mean the total of the Price for completion of Works including the price for operation and maintenance of the Solar Power Plant, as mentioned in the work order.

4.RATES TO HOLD GOOD IN CASE THE PERIOD OF THE CONTRACT IS EXTENDED

4.1 The percentage rate/rates quoted by the Contractor in Schedule of items and accepted by the ANERT shall hold good for all works done towards the completion of the contract whether during the period mentioned herein or during the extended period, if any.

5.WARRANTY

5.1 The Contractor hereby warrants to the Beneficiary that the Scope of Work as executed by the Contractor shall be of good workmanship for a period of 5 years from Acceptance. During the period of 5years from the date of completion of work (“Warranty Period”) the Contractor shall rectify any part of the Works done found defective due to faulty materials and workmanship, for reasons solely attributable to the Contractor.
5.2 The Contractor will obtain manufacturers’ warranties on the PV modules, inverters, as well as other components of the Power Plant for which manufacturer’s warranties are available, in the name of the Beneficiary. Up until Acceptance, the Contractor will exercise any rights under the manufacturers’ warranties on behalf of the Beneficiary.

6.SERVICE OF NOTICE

   Every notice to be given to the Contractor may be given to him personally or left at his residence or last known place of abode or business or handed over to his agent, personally or may be addressed to the Contractor by post at his usual or last known place of abode or business and if so addressed and posted shall be deemed to have been served on the Contractor on the date on which in the ordinary course of post, a letter so addressed and posted would reach his place of abode or business.

7.ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING

   The Contractor shall not assign or make over the Contract or the benefits or burdens thereof, or any part thereof, to any other person or persons or body corporate. The Contractor shall not underlet or sublet to any person or persons or body Corporate, the execution of the Contract or any part thereof without the consent, in writing, of the ANERT

8.FORCE MAJEURE

8.1 Force majeure shall mean any cause, existing or future, which is beyond the reasonable control of any of the parties including acts of God, storm, fire, floods, explosion, epidemics, quarantine, earthquake, strike, riot, lock out, embargo, interference by civil or military authorities, acts, regulations or orders of any governmental authority in their sovereign capacity, acts of war (declared or undeclared) including any acts of terrorism.
8.2 None of the parties shall be liable for the failure to perform any obligation in terms of this Agreement if and to such extent such failure is caused by a Force Majeure, provided that none of such acts of Force Majeure will relieve the Beneficiary from meeting its payment obligations.
8.3 The party prevented to fulfil its obligations (hereinafter referred to as "the Affected Party") by Force Majeure shall notify the other party through written means including fax/email/ post within one week after occurrence and cessation of such Force Majeure and it shall be established by the Affected Party that the Force Majeure had delayed performance of the Affected Party’s obligations and services and was beyond the reasonable control of the Affected Party and not due to the default or negligence of the Affected Party.
8.4 The periods for performance of this Agreement as agreed upon shall be extended by the periods of delay caused by such Force Majeure, as long as the period of Force Majeure does not last longer than three months.
8.5 If a Force Majeure continues for more than three months and the parties are not able to reach an agreement on the continuation of the Agreement within a further term of one month, the fulfilment of the Agreement shall automatically be deemed impossible and shall stand suspended / terminated.

9.INSOLVENCY OR LIQUIDATION

   In case the Contractor becomes insolvent or goes in to liquidation or makes or proposes to make any assignment for the benefit of his creditors or proposes any composition with his creditors for the settlement of his debts or carries on his business or the contract under inspection on behalf of his creditors or in case any orders for the administration of his estate are made against him or in case the Contractor shall commit any act of insolvency or in case in which, under any clause or clauses of this contract the Contractor shall have rendered himself liable to damages amounting to the whole of his security deposit, the Contract be determined and the Contract agreement authority may complete the contract in such person as the ANERT shall think fit. But such termination of the contract shall be without any prejudice to any right of remedy of the ANERT against the Contractor or his sureties in respect of any breach of contract committed by the Contractor.

10.BREACH OF CONTRACT

   If the Contractor commits breach of all or any of the Terms or Conditions of Contract the ANERT shall be entitled to recover from the Contractor all damages it might suffer thereby. The amount thus due could be recovered from the Contractor in any manner the ANERT chooses including recovery by Revenue Recovery Proceedings.

11.SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES

   In case of disputes between the Contractor and the ANERT, the matter shall be referred to a ‘Dispute Resolution Committee’ to be formed by the ANERT for resolving the dispute.

12.LAW AND JURISDICTION OF CONTRACT

   Any dispute arising out of this contract will be subject to the Exclusive Jurisdiction of Civil Courts at Thiruvananthapuram.

13.PERFORMANCE GUARANTEE:

   During the Performance Guarantee period of 5 years from the date of handing over, the Contractor shall repair free of charge, any defect noticed in the works and/or any damage or defects or functional failure noticed in any accessory transported or installed by the Contractor which fails or proves unsatisfactory under normal operations due to his faulty material handling or workmanship. However, during the guarantee period, if the Contractor fails to rectify the defects if any, in reasonable time, the ANERT shall arrange to make good the defects in works, accessories etc. and the amount incurred by the ANERT on this account will be recovered together with additional % of the expenses as decided by the ANERT from the amounts payable to the Contractor.

14.RELEASE OF PERFORMANCE GUARANTEE:

   The Performance Guarantee will be released in two instalments – one at the at the end of one year of operation and the other after the five years of warranty period. The Contractor hereby agrees to extend the period of validity of Bank Guarantee/additional amount if used by ANERT to rectify the defects occurred from time to time on behalf of the contractor towards Performance Guarantee under this contract till such an extension is not required by the Contract agreement.

15.BINDING AGREEMENT:

   This Agreement, along with its Schedules, in and of itself is an enforce able binding contract and constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof to the exclusion of all other understandings and assurances, either written or oral. The clauses contained in this Agreement shall not be construed as creating a Partnership or Joint Venture, Agency or Employment relationship among the Parties. The relationship between the Parties under this Agreement is as principal to principal basis.

IN WITNESS WHERE OF    the authorized signatories of the Parties hereto have signed this Agreement on the day, month and year first above written:



For and On Behalf of ANERT For and On Behalf Of

{% set docu=doc.linked_documents %} {% for row in docu %} {% if row.docname=='MNRE Agreement' %} {% set name =row.docid%} {% set dof= frappe.get_doc('MNRE Agreement',name) %} {% set company= frappe.get_doc('Company',doc.company)%}
Agreement
Between the applicant and the registered/empanelled Vendor for installation of rooftop solar system in residential house of the Applicant under simplified procedure of Rooftop Solar Programme Ph- II
This agreement is executed on 26-December-2022 for design, installation, commissioning and five years comprehensive maintenance of rooftop solar system to be installed under simplified procedure of Rooftop Solar Programme Ph-II.
Between
{% if dof.customer%} {{dof.customer}} {% endif %} having residential electricity connection with consumer number {% if dof.consumer_number %} {{dof.consumer_number}} {% endif %} from KSEB LTD. (DISCOM) at {{doc.primary_address}} (here in after referred as Applicant).
And
{{doc.company}} is registered / empanelled with the KSEB Ltd. (hereinafter referred as DISCOM) and is having registered/functional office at {% set add1= frappe.get_doc('Address',company.address) %} {{add1.address_line1}} {{add1.city}} {{add1.state}} (hereinafter referred as Vendor).
Both Applicant and the Vendor are jointly referred as Parties.
whereas
-The Applicant intends to install rooftop solar system under simplified procedure of Rooftop Solar Programme Ph-II of the MNRE.

-The Vendor is registered/empanelled vendor with DISCOM for installation of rooftop solar under MNRE Schemes. The Vendor satisfies all the existing regulation pertaining to electrical safety and license in the respective state and it is not debarred or blacklisted from undertaking any such installations by any state/central Government agency..

-Both the parties are mutually agreed and understand their roles and responsibilities and have no liability to any other agency/firm/stakeholder especially to DISCOM and MNRE.

1. GENERAL TERMS:
1.1 he Applicant hereby represents and warrants that the Applicant has the sole legal capacity to enter into this Agreement and authorize the construction, installation and commissioning of the Rooftop Solar System (“RTS System”) which is inclusive of Balance of System (“BoS”) on the Applicant’s premises (“Applicant Site”). The Vendor reserves its right to verify ownership of the Applicant Site and Applicant covenants to co-operate and provide all information and documentation required by the Vendor for the same.
1.2 Vendor may propose changes to the scope, nature and or schedule of the services being performed under this Agreement. All proposed changes must be mutually agreed between the Parties. If Parties fail to agree on the variation proposed, either Party may terminate this Agreement by serving notice as per Clause 13.
1.3 The Applicant understands and agrees that future changes in load, electricity usage patterns and/or electricity tariffs may affect the economics of the RTS System and these factors have not been and cannot be considered in any analysis or quotation provided by Vendor or its Authorized Persons (defined below).
2. RTS SYSTEM
2.1 Total capacity of RTS System will be minimum 3 kWp.
2.2 The Solar modules, inverters and BoS will confirm to minimum specifications and DCR requirement of MNRE.
2.3 Solar modules of Premier make PE515HM model, 515Wp capacity each and 21.09 % efficiency will be procured and installed by the Vendor
2.4 Solar inverter of SOFAR make, KTLM3000 model, 3kW rated output capacity will be procured and installed by the Vendor
2.5 Module mounting structure has to withstand minimum wind load pressure as specified by MNRE..
2.6 Other BoS installations shall be as per best industry practice with all safety and protection gears installed by the vendor.
3. PRICE AND PAYMENT TERMS
3.1 The cost of RTS System will be Rs. 2,20,000 /- (to be decided mutually). The Applicant shall pay the total cost to the Vendor as under:

(i) 60% as an advance on confirmation of the order;
(ii) 35% after installation;
(iii) 05% after commissioning of the RTS System.
3.2 The order value and payment terms are fixed and will not be subject to any adjustment except as approved in writing by Vendor. The payment shall be made only through bankers’ cheque
/ NEFT / RTGS / online payment portal as intimated by Vendor. No cash payments shall be accepted by Vendor or its Authorized Person.
4. REPRESENTATIONS MADE BY THE APPLICANT:
The Applicant acknowledges and agrees that:
4.1 any timeline or schedule shared by Vendor for the provision of services and delivery of the RTS System is only an estimate and Vendor will not be liable for any delay that is not attributable to Vendor;
4.2 all information disclosed by the Applicant to Vendor in connection with the supply of the RTS System (or any part thereof), services and generation estimation (including, without limitation, the load profile and power bill) are true and accurate, and acknowledges that Vendor has relied on the information produced by the Applicant to customize the RTS System layout and BoS design for the purposes of this Agreement;
4.3 all descriptive specifications, illustrations, drawings, data, dimensions, quotation, fact sheets, price lists and any advertising material circulated/published/provided by Vendor are approximate only;
4.4 any drawings, pre-feasibility report, specifications and plans composed by Vendor shall require the Applicant’s approval within 5 (five) days of its receipt by electronic mail to Vendor and if the Applicant does not respond within this period, the drawings, specifications or plans shall be final and deemed to have been approved by the Applicant;
4.5 the Applicant shall not use the RTS System or any part thereof, other than in accordance with the product manufacturer’s specifications, and covenants that any risk arising from misuse or/and misappropriate use shall be to the account of the Applicant alone.
4.6 The Applicant represents, warrants and covenants that:

(i)  all electrical and plumbing infrastructure at the Applicant Site are in conformity with applicable laws;
(ii) the Applicant has the legal capacity to permit unfettered access to Vendor and its Authorized Persons for the purposes of execution and performance of this Agreement;
(iii)  the Applicant has and will provide requisite power, water and other requisite resources and storage facilities for construction, installation, operation and maintenance of the RTS System;
(iv) the Applicant will ensure that the Applicant Site is shadow free and free of all encumbrances during the lifetime of the RTS System;
(v)  Applicant should ensure that the Applicant regularly cleans and ensures accessibility and safety to the RTS System, as required by Vendor and dusting frequency in the premises.
(vi) Vendor is entitled to permit geo-tagging of the Applicant Site as a Vendor installation site;
(vii) Unless otherwise intimated by the Applicant in writing, Vendor is entitled to take photographs, videos and testimonials of the Applicant and the Applicant Site, and to create content which will become the property of Vendor and the same can be freely used by Vendor as part of its promotional and marketing activities across all platforms as it deems fit;
(viii) the Applicant validates the stability of the Applicant Site for the installation of the RTS System.
5. MAINTENANCE:
5.1 Vendor shall provide five-year free workmanship maintenance. Vendor shall visit the Applicant’s premises at least once every quarter after commissioning of the RTS System for maintenance purposes.
5.2 During such maintenance visit, Vendor shall check all nuts and bolts, fuses, earth resistance and other consumables in respect of the RTS System to ensure that it is in good working condition.
5.3 Cleaning requirement/expectation from the Applicant side – Applicant responsibility, minimum expectation from Applicant that it will be cleaned regularly as per the dusting frequency.
6. MAINTENANCE:
6.1 The Applicant hereby grants permission to Vendor and its authorized personnel, representatives, associates, officers, employees, financing agents, subcontractors (“Authorized Persons”) to enter the Applicant Site for the purposes of:
(a)  conducting feasibility study;
(b)  storing the RTS System/any part thereof;
(c)  installing the RTS System;
(d)  inspecting the RTS System;
(e)  conducting repairs and maintenance to the RTS System;
(f)  removing the RTS System (or any part thereof), if necessary for any reason whatsoever;
(g)  rSuch other matters as necessary to execute and perform its rights and obligations under this Agreement.
5.2 The Applicant shall ensure that third-party consents necessary for the Authorized Persons to access the Applicant Site are obtained prior to commencement of services under this Agreement.
7. WARRANTIES:
7.1 Product Warranty: The Applicant shall be entitled to manufacturers’ warranty. Any warranty in relation to RTS System supplied to the Applicant by Vendor under this Agreement is limited to the warranty given by the manufacturer of the RTS System (or any part thereof) to Vendor.
7.2 Installation Warranty: Vendor warrants that all installations shall be free from workmanship defects or BOS defects for a period of five years from the date of installation of the RTS System. The warranty is limited to Vendor rectifying the workmanship or BOS defects at Vendor’s expense in respect of those defects reported by the Applicant, in writing. The Applicant is obliged and liable to report such defects within 15 (fifteen) days of occurrence of such defect.
7.3 Subject to manufacturer warranty, Vendor warrants that the solar modules supplied herein shall have tolerance within a five-percentage range (+/-5%). The peak-power point voltage and the peak-power point current of any supplied solar module and/or any module string (series connected modules) shall not vary by more than 5% (five percent) from the respective arithmetic means for all modules and/or for all module strings, as the case may be, provided the RTS System is properly maintained and the Applicant Site is free from shadow at the time of operation of the RTS System.
7.4 Exceptions for warranty:

(a) Any attempt by any person other than Vendor or its Authorized Persons to adjust, modify, repair or provide maintenance to the RTS System, shall disentitle the Applicant of the warranty provided by Vendor hereunder.
(b) Vendor shall not be liable for any degeneration or damage to the RTS System due to any action or inaction on the part of the Applicant.
(c) Vendor shall not be bound or liable to remedy any damage, fault, failure or malfunction of the RTS System owing to external causes, including but not limited to accidents, misuse, neglect, if usage and/or storage and/or installation are non-confirming to product instructions, modifications by the Applicant leading to shading or accessibility issues, failure to perform required maintenance, normal wear and tear, Force Majeure Event, or negligence or default attributable to the Applicant.
(d) Vendor shall not be liable to repair or remedy any accessories or parts added to the RTS System that were not originally sourced by Vendor to the Applicant.
8. PERFORMANCE GUARANTEE:
8.1 Vendor guarantees minimum system performance ratio of 75% as per performance ratio test carried out in adherence to IEC 61724 or equivalent BIS for a period of five years.
9. INSURANCE:
9.1 Vendor may, at its sole discretion, obtain insurance covering risks of loss/damage to the RTS System (any part thereof) during transit from Vendor’s warehouse until delivery to the Applicant Site and until installation and commissioning.
9.2 Thereafter, all risk shall pass on to the Applicant and the Applicant may accordingly procure relevant insurances.
10. CANCELLATION
10.1 The Applicant may cancel the order placed on Vendor within 7 (seven) days from the date of remittance of advance money or the date of order acceptance, whichever is earlier (“Order Confirmation”) by serving notice as per Clause 13.
10.2 If the Applicant cancels the order after the expiry of 7 (seven) days from the date of Order Form, the Applicant shall be liable to pay Vendor, a cancellation fee of XX% of the total order value plus costs and expenses incurred by Vendor, including, costs for labour, design, return of products, administrative costs, subvention costs.
10.3 Notwithstanding the aforesaid, the Applicant shall not be entitled to cancel the Order Form after Vendor has dispatched the RTS System (or any part thereof, including BOS) to the Applicant Site. If Applicant chooses to terminate the Order Form after dispatch, the entire amount paid by the Applicant till date, shall be forfeited by Vendor.
11. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INDEMNITY:
11.1 To the extent that terms implied by law apply to the RTS System and the services rendered under this Agreement, Vendor’s liability for any breach of those terms is limited to: (a) repairing or replacing the RTS System/any part thereof, as applicable; or
(b) Refund of the moneys paid by the Applicant to Vendor, if Vendor cannot fulfil the order.
12. SUSPENSION AND TERMINATION:
12.1 If the Applicant fails to pay any sum due under this Agreement on the due date, Vendor may, in addition to its other rights under this Agreement, suspend its obligations under this Agreement until all outstanding amounts (including interest due) are paid.
13. NOTICES:
Any notice or other communication under this Agreement to Vendor and or to the Applicant, shall be in writing, in English language and shall be delivered or sent: (a) by electronic mail and/or (b) by hand delivery or registered post/courier, at the registered address of Applicant/Vendor.
14. FORCE MAJEURE EVENT:
14.1 If the Applicant fails to pay any sum due under this Agreement on the due date, Vendor may, in addition to its other rights under this Agreement, suspend its obligations under this Agreement until all outstanding amounts (including interest due) are paid.
15. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION:
15.1 The interpretation and enforcement of this Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India
15.2 In the event of any dispute, controversy or difference between the Parties arising out of, or relating to this Agreement (“Dispute”), both Parties shall make an effort to resolve the Dispute in good faith, failing which, any Party to the Dispute shall be entitled to refer the Dispute to arbitration to resolve the Dispute in the manner set out in this Clause. The rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect pending the award in such arbitration proceeding.
15.3 The arbitration proceeding shall be governed by the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and shall be settled by a sole arbitrator mutually appointed by the Parties.

  And whereas the consumer has in addition to those automatic and inbuilt isolation devices with in inverter and external manual relays, installed a manually operated isolating switch and associated equipment with sufficient safe guards between the solar energy system and the distribution system of {{bd.description}} to prevent injection of electricity from his solar energy system to the distribution system of the Licensee when the distribution system is de-energized;
  And whereas, the consumer has assured that in case of a power outage in the system of {{bd.description}}, his/her plant will not inject power into the distribution system of the licensee and has produced separately the documents sustaining this assurance which for part of this agreement, as if incorporated herein;
   And whereas, the consumer has undertaken that all the equipment connected to the distribution system comply with relevant international (IEEE/IEC) or Indian Standards (BIS) and that installations of electrical equipment‟s comply with the relevant provisions of the Central Electricity Authority (Measures relating to Safety and Electric Supply) Regulations, 2010 as amended from time to time;

  And whereas, the consumer undertakes that he/she is in possession of all the necessary approvals and clearances, including sanction from Electrical Inspector, as specified in relevant regulations for connecting the solar energy system to the distribution system for commissioning the solar energy system.

[strike out this portion if the meter is provided by the consumer at his/her cost];

Now therefore, both the parties hereby agree as follows:-
1. The net-metering connection shall be governed by the provisions contained in the Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission (Renewable Energy & Net Metering) Regulations, 2020 as amended from time to time and also subject to the condition that solar energy system meets the requirements as per the provisions contained in Central Electricity Authority (Technical Standards for Connectivity of the Distributed Generation Recourses) Regulations, 2013 as amended from time to time.
2. {{bd.description}} shall have the sole authority to decide, based on the results of necessary studies, the interface/interconnection point to the solar energy system.
3. The validity of the agreement will be 25 years from the date of this agreement.
4. If the consumer’s solar energy system either causes damage to and / or produces adverse effects affecting other consumers or assets of {{bd.description}}, the consumer will have to disconnect solar energy system immediately from the distribution system, upon direction from the {{bd.description}} and correct the defect at his own expense, prior to reconnection.
5. {{bd.description}} shall have access to the metering equipment and disconnecting means for solar energy system in all required situations.
6. {{bd.description}} shall have the right to disconnect the solar energy system from distribution system of the licensee in emergency, if it is found that at that point in the time providing service through the net-metering system is not safe to the grid as a whole.
7. The consumer indemnifies for the damages or adverse effects, if any, from the negligence or intentional defective operation in the connection and operation in the connection and operation of the solar energy system of the consumer;
8. {{bd.description}} shall not be liable for delivery to or realization by the consumer of any fiscal or other incentives provided by the Central/State Government or any other authority;





{{ dof.customer_name }}




{{bd.description}}
9. All the commercial settlements under this agreement shall follow the provisions of the Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission (Renewable Energy & Net Metering) Regulations, 2020 as amended from time to time
10 The consumer/KSEBL may terminate this agreement after giving thirty days’(30days) clear notice in writing to the authorized authority of the Licensee/consumer.
11. KSEB Limited has the right to terminate this agreement at any point of time after giving 30 days’ prior notice if consumer breaches any terms of this agreement and in cases where such breaches could be rectified and the same are not provided/informed within 30 days of written notice from KSEB Limited about the breach.
12. The consumer agrees that upon termination of this agreement, he must disconnect the solar energy system from distribution system of KSEB Limited in a timely manner to the satisfaction of KSEB Limited.
13. The consumer shall have the right to bank and use the electricity generated and injected in excess over his/her full consumption into the distribution system of the licensee by the solar energy system subject to the conditions specified in the Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission (Renewable Energy& Net Metering) Regulations, 2020as amended from time to time
14. The consumer shall have the right for wheeling the excess electricity generated, by the solar energy system installed in the premises of the consumer (detailed under item II of the attached schedule), in accordance with Regulation 17 of KSERC (Renewable Energy & Net Metering) Regulations, 2020 as amended from time to time and shall be used in the premises owned by the consumer and in the order of preference as detailed under item III of the attached schedule.
15. The licensee shall within seven days from the date of execution of this agreement, connect the solar energy system
16. The licensee shall pay for the net energy banked by the consumer at the end of settlement period at the average pooled purchase cost of KSEB Ltd as approved by the Commission from time to time, as stated in the Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission (Renewable Energy & Net Metering) Regulations, 2020 as amended from time to time.

Vendor/ Bidders’ Declaration Format associated with Implementation of ALMM Order
Declaration


To whomsoever this may concern

Reference: Simplified procedure of MNRE for installation of rooftop solar project


1.

We hereby declare that we are fully aware of the binding provisions of the ALMM order and the Lists thereunder, while installing the rooftop solar system of {{doc.panel_capacity}} KW capacity at the residence of {{doc.consumer_name}} having project site at {{doc.primary_address}}

2.

We understand that the List – I (Solar PV Modules) of ALMM Order, Annexure – I of the O M, issued by MNRE on 10th March 2021 will be updated by MNRE from time to time. We also understand that the Modules to be procured for this project, shall be from the List – I of the ALMM order applicable on the date of invoicing of such modules.

3.

We further understand and accept that we shall be liable for penal action, including but not limited to blacklisting, if we are found not complying with the provisions of ALMM Order, including those mentioned above.

4.

The details of SPV modules installed at the site are as follows:

Make: {{doc.panel_make}}    Capacity: {{doc.capacity_in_watts}}W    Quantity: {{doc.number_of_panels}}
Sl.Nos:{% if doc.serial_no %} {% for row in doc.serial_no %} {% if row.spv_serial_no %}{{ row.spv_serial_no }}, {% endif %} {% endfor %} {% endif %}











NAME:Ratheesh
Designation: MANAGING PARTNER
Organization: Acube Innovation.Pvt LTD
Date:

SOURA– PHASE II SUBSIDY SCHEME
TRIPARTITE AGREEMENT BETWEEN CONSUMER, EPC CONTRACTOR & {{bd.abbreviation}} FOR ROOFTOP SOLAR PLANT INSTALLATION - CONSUMER OWNED PLANTS (Model II)
(Annexure to Contract Agreement between Contractor and {{bd.description}} )
1. Sri/Smt {{dof.customer_name}} (consumer) having electricity consumer no. {% if dof.consumer_number %}{{dof.consumer_number}}{% endif%} in {% set opp = frappe.get_doc("Customer",{"opportunity_name" : doc.oppertunity}) %} {% set add = frappe.get_doc("Address" ,opp.customer_primary_address) %} {% if(add.address_line1) %} {{add.address_line1}}{% else %} {% endif %}, {% if(add.address_line2) %} {{add.address_line2}}{% else %} {% endif %}, {% if(add.city) %} {{add.city}}{% else %} {% endif %}, {% if(add.state) %} {{add.state}}{% else %} {% endif %}, {% if(add.country) %} {{add.country}}{% else %} {% endif %}, {% if(add.postal_code) %} {{add.postal_code}}{% else %} {% endif %} (address of the residential building) wishes to install a rooftop solar plant having capacity {% if dof.item_capacity %}{{ dof.item_capacity }}{% endif %} on the rooftop/premises of the said building through the empanelled contractor of {{bd.description}}, M/s {{doc.company}}
{% set link=doc.linked_documents %} {% for lin in link %} {% if lin.docname=='Quotation' %} {% set name1 =lin.docid%} {% set quo= frappe.get_doc('Quotation',name1) %} 2. M/s.{{doc.company}} have examined the aforesaid rooftop and found it feasible to install {% for item in quo.items %}{% if item.item_code %} {% set variant_item = frappe.get_doc("Item", item.item_code) %} {{ variant_item.item_name }}{% endif %}{% endfor %} Roof Top Solar plant
AND
3. Sri/Smt/ ............................................................................................................. (Name and designation) acting for and on behalf of {{bd.full_name}} The contractor shall install , commission and carry out O & M for 5 year period at an amount of Rs {% if dof.grand_total %}{{dof.get_formatted("grand_total")}} {% endif %}/- only as per the published rate by {{bd.abbreviation}}. The consumer shall pay their investment portion (above amount less the subsidy amount) Rs {% if dof.amount %}{{ dof.amount }}{% endif %}/ to the contractor fully upon receipt of clearance letter from {{bd.abbreviation}}. (The amount mentioned may slightly vary subject to the exact plant capacity installed).


TERMS & CONDITIONS:
I. The Consumer hereby undertakes to:
i. Pay the consumer investment portion to the contractor directly based on the clearance letter issued by {{bd.abbreviation}} and the payment shall be made within 2 days of issuing the clearance letter by {{bd.abbreviation}}.
ii. Provide secure storage of the material of the RTS plant delivered at the premises.
iii. Provide access to the Roof Top during installation of the plant, operation & maintenance, testing of the plant and equipment and for meter reading from solar meter, inverter etc.
iv. Provide electricity during plant installation and water for cleaning of the panels.
v. Maintain the area shadow free.
vi. Report any malfunctioning of the plant to the contractor during the warranty period.


II. The Contractor hereby undertakes to:
i. Design, Supply, Installation, test and commission the RTS plant within the time frame as per contract agreement with {{bd.abbreviation}}.
ii. Handover the warranty certificates of the plant and associated installations to the consumer with intimation to {{bd.abbreviation}} upon completion of plant installation.
iii. Maintain periodically the plant including meters during the O & M period from date of commercial operation of the RTS plant.
iv. Handover the plant to the consumer in satisfactory condition as per the contract, upon completion of the O & M period.


III. KSEBL hereby undertakes
i. To publish the total plant cost , consumer investment amount and subsidy amount
ii. To monitoring ,witnessing testing & commissioning of the plant
iii. To ensure that the contractor carries out O & M of the plant as per the contract agreement between contractor and {{bd.abbreviation}}.







IV. GENERAL
i. Warranty of the plant will be invalid if the installation is tampered, modified, altered etc.
ii. The cost of netmeter, cables exceeding 50m (AC and DC) and any additional works are not included in the Plant cost.
iii. The consumer shall not be liable for disputes, if any, between {{bd.description}} and Contractor, which are not due to default of the consumer.
iv. If any additional work is involved for the plant installation (eg. Installation on Elevated structure/ slanted/tiled/sheet roofs) as per site condition and requirement of the consumer building, the contractor shall prepare an estimate and can raise separate invoice including GST in addition to the amount towards standard plant cost. The consumer shall pay the amount for such additional work directly to the contractor.
v. If consumer is doing such additional structure works by themselves it shall comply with the design provided by the contractor and also the contractor shall not be responsible for the warranty for such mounting structure.
vi. The contractor shall rectify any malfunctioning/ breakdown of the plant within 15 days from date of receipt of information regarding such malfunctioning, failing which loss to the consumer/{{bd.description}} on account of such breakdown shall be recovered from the contractor.
vii. Any dispute arising between consumer and contractor shall be settled between them.
viii. In case in a site due to shade issues the Performance Ratio( PR) 75 % , as per {{bd.abbreviation}} contract conditions cannot be achieved and if the consumer is desirous of installing the plant at such reduced PR then
    (1) The contractor shall declare the achievable PR
    (2) The consumer shall give written consent for plant installation at such reduced PR and subsequent to the above, plant can be installed in such sites.

  • We also undertake that the installation as done in compliance with the technical specifications mentioned by ANERT in the Tender for the aforementioned work.
  • Copy of Maintenance & Operation Manual
  • Test report of net meter tested at the laboratory of the DISCOM (in case of On-Grid/Hybrid)
  • In case of any discrepancy found during the inspection by ANERT, we shall replace the component with those mentioned above within 7 days and shall report the same.
  • If the Standard of workmanship is not found to satisfactory during the inspection by ANERT, we shall do a complete re-installation work at our own expense within 15 days and shall be properly reported to ANERT.
  • If the foundation works for the Solar MMS is not meeting the specifications as per the tender during the inspection, we shall re-do the concrete foundation at our own cost. Also, during the 25 years of performance warranty for the PV module, any sort of damages occur to the Solar MMS,(other than intentional man made damages) or if the MMS fails to withstand the wind speed as per the tender, we undertake to repair/replace the system at our own expense.
  • The Insurance for the power plant for the entire period of warranty and the operation manual along with the Warranty card (including Manufacturer warranty cards) must be submitted to the beneficiary institution and copy to ANERT District Office.
  • The required documents for the connectivity of the power plant are submitted with the DISCOM and we shall do the liaison work with the authorities so that the Power plant can be commissioned at the earliest. (Applicable for Grid Connected and Hybrid Plants only)
  • We shall submit a separate commissioning report along with a copy of the connectivity certificate and PPA agreement between the DISCOM and the beneficiary.
